newsitem.title: USA: ARCO, LUKoil to sign $5 bln joint venture.
newsitem.headline: ARCO, LUKoil to sign $5 bln joint venture.

text.p: Atlantic Richfield Co (ARCO) and Russia's LUKoil plan to sign a $5.2 billion, 18-year joint venture agreement Friday night, company officials said Friday.
ARCO President Mike Bowlin and LUKoil President Vagit Alekperov will be signing the agreement, announced last September, at the Russian Embassy here, they said.

"This is a big day for ARCO," Bowlin said at a luncheon for the Moscow International Petroleum Club. He said the long-term agreement was "one that will be beneficial to both companies and to both countries."

ARCO officials said although the agreement was reached last September, the terms were only recently finalized. ARCO, which owns around eight percent of LUKoil, is signing the agreement in order to establish a long-term framework to develop oil and gas projects in the Former Soviet Union.
Kenneth Dickerson, a senior vice president of ARCO, said ARCO wanted to team up with a Russian company before investing heavily in Russia and the Former Soviet Union.
"This gives us a better chance to extend the relationship long term," he told Reuters.
